{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":15269,"attracts":[],"care_guides_details":[{"type":"watering","description":"Iresine diffusa enjoys consistently moist soil, so regular watering is crucial to keeping this plant healthy. Water the plant thoroughly when the top inch of soil is dry to the touch, ensuring that water can drain freely from the bottom of the pot to prevent waterlogging, which can lead to root rot. During the growing season (spring and summer), you might need to increase the watering frequency to maintain optimal moisture levels. In contrast, reduce watering during the dormant winter months but do not let the soil dry out completely. Always monitor the soil's moisture level to adjust your watering schedule accordingly."},{"type":"sunlight","description":"Iresine diffusa thrives in bright, indirect sunlight. It should be placed near a window where it can receive abundant, filtered light throughout the day. Although the plant can tolerate some direct sunlight, especially in the morning or late afternoon, too much intense midday sun can scorch its leaves. If grown indoors, turning the plant occasionally will ensure even growth. In low-light conditions, the plant may become leggy, which is a sign that it requires more light. Outdoor plants should be situated in a semi-shaded area to protect them from excessive sun exposure."},{"type":"pruning","description":"Pruning Iresine diffusa helps maintain its shape and encourages bushier growth. Trim the plant regularly by pinching off the growing tips with your fingers or using clean pruning shears to cut just above a leaf node. This process will stimulate the plant to produce more branches, resulting in a fuller appearance. Remove any dead, damaged, or yellowing leaves to keep the plant looking its best and minimize disease risks. The best time to prune is during the growing season, in spring and summer, as this is when the plant is actively producing new growth."}],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"Juba's Bush","description":"Iresine diffusa (Juba's bush) is a species of plant in the Amaranthaceae family.","family":null,"flower_color":"White","flowering_season":false,"fruit_color":null,"growth_rate":"Moderate","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["Green"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["Central America","South America"],"other_name":["Juba's Bush"],"pest_susceptibility":["Fungal leaf spot"],"propagation":["Cutting","Seed Propagation"],"pruning_month":["February"],"scientific_name":["Iresine diffusa"],"soil":["Well-drained","Loamy"],"watering_period":"Morning"}}

Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings, as this plant does not like to sit in overly moist soil and can develop root rot if overwatered. In its growing season during the spring and summer months, ensure consistent moisture but reduce the frequency of watering during its dormant phase in the fall and winter. For best growth and flowering, provide it with at least 6 hours of direct sunlight each day. When planted in a location with less sunlight, the plant may grow leggy and produce fewer flowers, reducing its overall decorative appeal. In very hot climates, some afternoon shade can help prevent leaf burn. Placing it in a south-facing spot or another sunny location will help it maintain its vibrant variegated foliage and white bracts, which are its main ornamental features."},{"type":"pruning","description":"Pruning Euphorbia marginata is beneficial for encouraging a more compact growth habit and removing any dead or damaged stems. The best time to prune is early in the spring before new growth begins. Use clean, sharp pruning shears to make cuts just above a node or healthy leaf set. Be cautious of the plant's milky sap, which can be irritating; wear gloves to protect your skin. Pruning not only helps control the size of the plant but can also stimulate blooming and remove any faded flowers to maintain its ornamental appearance."}],"care_level":"Easy","common_name":"snow-on-the-mountain","description":"Euphorbia marginata (commonly known as snow-on-the-mountain, smoke-on-the-prairie, variegated spurge, or whitemargined spurge) is a small annual in the spurge family.","family":null,"flower_color":"White","flowering_season":false,"fruit_color":null,"growth_rate":"Moderate","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["Green"],"maintenance":"Low","origin":["North America"],"other_name":["snow-on-the-mountain"],"pest_susceptibility":["Fungal leaf spot","Root rot"],"propagation":["Seed Propagation"],"pruning_month":["October"],"scientific_name":["Euphorbia marginata"],"soil":["Well-drained"],"watering_period":"Morning"}}
